instruction:
A job description is a document that clearly states the requirements, duties, responsibilities, and skills required to perform a specific role. You need to write a job description based on the given information. You should describe responsibilities and duties in your job description in a logical order. Remember that potential employees often get their first impression of your company from your job description. So, the job description should convey the attractiveness of your company.

Company: [Company name]
Job: Software Engineer
Job Responsibilities:
Receive and perform code reviews with other engineers.
Write unit, integration, and end-to-end tests to verify functionality using automated testing frameworks such as Pytest.
Work collaboratively with fellow software engineers to build features requested by business stakeholders.
Participate in Agile teams to develop, test, and debug complex data processing pipelines and data analysis applications using big data processing systems such as Apache Spark.
Diagnose, debug, and perform root cause analysis of issues and defects.
Skills and experience that will lead to success:
Experience with a modern software programming language. We use Python, and Pyspark extensively.
Experience with cloud systems like AWS or Azure
Experience writing SQL queries 
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Eagerness to work in a highly-collaborative environment
Some visualization experience such as Tableau or PowerBI is helpful
output:
Here is the job description you requested:

Job: Software Engineer
Receive and perform code reviews with other engineers.
Write unit, integration, and end-to-end tests to verify functionality using automated testing frameworks such as Pytest.
Work collaboratively with fellow software engineers to build features requested by business stakeholders.
Participate in Agile teams to develop, test, and debug complex data processing pipelines and data analysis applications using big data processing systems such as Apache Spark.
Diagnose, debug, and perform root cause analysis of issues and defects.

Requirements and Duties:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field.
2+ years of professional software engineering experience.
Experience with a modern software programming language. We use Python, and Pyspark extensively.
Experience with cloud systems like AWS or Azure
Experience writing SQL queries 
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Eagerness to work in a highly-collaborative environment
Some visualization experience such as Tableau or PowerBI is helpful

instruction:
Find synonyms for the given word. You need to write down how the provided synonyms differ from the original word in terms of meaning, usage, etc.

adversity
output: Adversity is a noun meaning “unfavorable or difficult circumstances.” Synonyms for adversity include difficulty, hardship, and trouble. These words all describe circumstances that are unpleasant or challenging, and are often used in connection with overcoming such circumstances. The words are similar in meaning, but adversity emphasizes the negative aspects of the circumstances, while difficulty emphasizes the challenge or test posed by the circumstances, and trouble emphasizes the disruption or disturbance caused by the circumstances.

Additionally, it is customary to include the names and email addresses of all participants in the email, as well as an optional subject line summarizing the purpose of the meeting. Finally, it is generally appropriate to request a response from the recipient confirming their understanding of the meeting details, as well as their availability to participate.

instruction: Write a step-by-step guide for resolving GitHub merge conflicts.
output:
A merge conflict occurs when two or more people have worked on the same file in a repository, and their changes conflict with each other. When this happens, you need to resolve the conflict before you can merge the changes into the master branch.

First, you need to identify the conflict. Open the file in a text editor, and look for conflicts. You’ll see a line like “<<<<<<< HEAD”, or “>>>>>>> master”. These are markers that indicate where the conflict starts and ends. Make sure you’re looking at the correct file, and that you’re in the correct branch.

Next, you need to resolve the conflict. If you’re the one who checked in the conflicting change, you’ll need to resolve it by choosing whether to keep your change or theirs. If you’re merging someone else’s change into your branch, you’ll need to resolve it by choosing whether to keep their change or yours. In either case, you’ll need to resolve the conflict by choosing one version of the change or the other.

instruction:
One or more jobs can be run automatically by a workflow. The workflows are defined in the repository as YAML files and will run if an event occurs in the repository, as well as manually, or on a certain schedule.
Bring an example of a workflow that demonstrate the CI/CD features of GitHub Actions.
output:
Here is a simple example of a GitHub Actions workflow file, called workflows/ci.yml:

- name: Check out code
  fetch:
    repo: my-org/my-repo
  ref: master

- name: Run tests
  run:
    name: Test
    image: python:3.6-alpine
  env:
    - name: CI
      value: true

- name: Publish to GitHub
  publish:
    repo: my-org/my-repo
  access: read

- name: Notify via Slack
  slack:
    text: "CI build succeeded for $GIT_COMMIT"

- name: Deploy to Heroku
  heroku:
    app: my-org-ci-build

- name: Run tests on Heroku
  run:
    name: Test

- name: Notify via email
  email:

  - to: "me@example.com"

  - subject: "CI build succeeded"

  - body: "The CI build for $GIT_COMMIT has succeeded."

- name: Complete the build
  complete:

- name: Check out code
  fetch:

- name: Run tests
  run:

- name: Publish to GitHub
  publish:

- name: Notify via Slack
  slack:

- name: Deploy to Heroku
  heroku:

- name: Run tests on Heroku
  run:

- name: Notify via email
  email:

- name: Complete the build
  complete:

instruction:
The movie tagline is the film's advertising slogan, usually printed on posters prior to the official release. It is a short description or comment on a movie to capture the essence of the movie, and ultimately make you watch the movie. Here is an example:

Movie: Joker (2019)
output:
The Joker is a 2019 American psychological thriller film directed by Todd Phillips, who also co-wrote the screenplay with Scott Silver. The film is based on the character of the same name from DC Comics, and serves as a standalone sequel to Batman Begins (2005). The film stars Joaquin Phoenix as the Joker, alongside Robert De Niro, Zazie Beetz, Frances Conroy, and Marc Maron. In the film, the Joker seeks to prove to himself that he is not a bad person, while simultaneously terrorizing Gotham City. 

The film was officially announced in 2017, following the success of Phillips's film War Dogs (2016). Phoenix was cast in the lead role later that year, with the rest of the cast being confirmed later. Principal photography began in New York City in May 2018, and wrapped up in November. The film was converted to 3D post-production and had its world premiere at the Venice Film Festival in August 2019, before being theatrically released in the United States on September 20, 2019, by Warner Bros.

The film was highly anticipated by both fans and critics, and went on to become a major box office success, grossing over $1 billion worldwide. It was widely praised for its unconventional narrative and dark humor, and was universally acclaimed by critics, who called it one of the best films of the year. It also won and was nominated for various awards, including winning the Golden Lion at the Venice Film Festival and receiving multiple nominations at the 92nd Academy Awards, including Best Actor for Phoenix, and ultimately winning Best Picture and Best Director for Phillips.

instruction:
You are given some reviews for a movie. Each video might have mentioned some negative or positive points about the movie. Read them carefully and extract the positive and negative points mentioned in all of the reviews. Then, make a list of these points and summarize them as positive points and negative points.

Review 1: I'm not sure if it's just the fact that Ed Norton really grates on me in this film, but I never really bought into the idea of Fight Club being some kind of cultural phenomenon. Yes it's an innovative story, told via a strong script, engaging characters and intense cinematography. But is it really worthy of such high praise? Personally, I find it starts to fall apart halfway through and actually becomes quite tedious towards the end. Everything just becomes a little bit childish and contrived as the story loses touch with its base elements and the rage against the machine vibe takes over. I have huge respect for the way this film was made but, much like The Matrix, I feel like people attach way more importance to this movie than it deserves.
Review 2: The film tells the story of men who cannot adapt to the social order in today's world, under the leadership of Tyler Durden, to discover their natural instinct, masculinity, and to escape from their unhappy lives.
Review 3: Despite a good theme, great acting and important messages that this movie convey in an unorthodox way, I think it fails to connect the audience with the storyline and leaves him in a world of confusion. Although, majority of reviews find this movie entertaining and interesting, yet I would choose to be a minority that believes that this movie is extremely overrated.
Review 4: Is creating chaos, explosions and membership in a militant sect the way to get rid of material shackles ?! The visual effects are fascinating and the story is compelling until the second half. Unfortunately, it doesn't end well.
output: The four reviews discuss various aspects of the film Fight Club, including the plot, acting, themes, and reception. The first review criticizes the film for having a convoluted storyline and becoming boring towards the end, while the second review praises the film’s themes and acting. The third review finds the film confusing and overrated, while the fourth review appreciates the film’s visual effects but criticizes its message and ending. Overall, the reviews present a mixed opinion of the film, which is considered to be innovative and engaging but also overrated and confusing.

instruction:
Answer the following question.

How do I compare strings in Java?
I've been using the == operator in my program to compare all my strings so far. However, I ran into a bug, changed one of them into .equals() instead, and it fixed the bug.
Is == bad? When should it and should it not be used? What's the difference?
output: Good question! The "==" operator is called the "equality" operator, and it compares the values of two objects, whereas .equals() compares the actual objects themselves. In general, it's recommended to use the equals() method for comparing objects, since it's more explicit about what you're doing, and also because the == equality operator can sometimes give false results. For example, it will compare the values of two strings, even though the actual objects are different, which can give a false result. So in general, it's recommended to use the equals() method.

instruction:
You are given two questions. Check if they are duplicates.

Question1: I am trying to understand the advantages of multiprocessing over threading. I know that multiprocessing gets around the Global Interpreter Lock, but what other advantages are there, and can threading not do the same thing?
Question2: I am learning how to use the threading and the multiprocessing modules in Python to run certain operations in parallel and speed up my code.
I am finding this hard (maybe because I don't have any theoretical background about it) to understand what the difference is between a threading.Thread() object and a multiprocessing.Process() one.
Also, it is not entirely clear to me how to instantiate a queue of jobs and having only 4 (for example) of them running in parallel, while the other wait for resources to free before being executed.
I find the examples in the documentation clear, but not very exhaustive; as soon as I try to complicate things a bit, I receive a lot of weird errors (like a method that can't be pickled, and so on).
So, when should I use the threading and multiprocessing modules?
Can you link me to some resources that explain the concepts behind these two modules and how to use them properly for complex tasks?
output:
The two questions are not duplicates, they address different aspects of the use of the threading and multiprocessing modules in Python.

In the first question, you are wondering about the advantages of using multiprocessing over threading, and in particular you mention the ability to bypass the Global Interpreter Lock. The Global Interpreter Lock is a limitation of the Python interpreter which prevents certain kinds of parallelism in Python programs. The multiprocessing module allows you to work around this limitation by allowing your program to spawn separate processes to execute in parallel, while the threading module allows you to create threads within the same process to execute in parallel. So in general, if you want to make use of parallelism in your program and are not specifically interested in bypassing the Global Interpreter Lock, you would use the threading module, while if you want to make use of the Global Interpreter Lock and are not specifically interested in parallelism, you would use the multiprocessing module.

In the second question, you are wondering how to make use of the multiprocessing and threading modules to speed up your program. In general, you would use the multiprocessing module to spawn separate processes to execute in parallel, while you would use the threading module to create threads within the same process to execute in parallel. You can use either module to create lightweight threads or processes, but note that the multiprocessing module is more robust and allows you to easily make use of the Global Interpreter Lock. Also note that the multiprocessing module is generally more complex to use correctly, and can be harder to understand.

instruction:
You are given a programming problem and its implementation. Analyze the problem and implementation and explain the algorithm and approach used to solve the problem.

Table: Person
| Column Name | Type     |
| personId          | int         |
| lastName         | varchar |
| firstName         | varchar |
personId is the primary key column for this table.
This table contains information about the ID of some persons and their first and last names.
Table: Address
| Column Name | Type     |
| addressId        | int         |
| personId          | int         |
| city                   | varchar|
| state                | varchar |
addressId is the primary key column for this table.
Each row of this table contains information about the city and state of one person with ID = PersonId.
Write an SQL query to report the first name, last name, city, and state of each person in the Person table. If the address of a personId is not present in the Address table, report null instead.
Return the result table in any order.
Implementation:
select FirstName, LastName, City, State
from Person left join Address
on Person.PersonId = Address.PersonId
;
output: The algorithm and approach used to solve this problem is to perform a left join between the Person and Address tables, using the PersonId column as the join key. This produces a result set with all Person records, along with corresponding Address records, or null if no matching Address record exists. The select statement then simply lists the first name, last name, city, and state for each Person record. This join approach is appropriate because the Person table has a primary key column (PersonId) which uniquely identifies each record, and the Address table also has a primary key column (PersonId) which references the corresponding Person records in the Person table.

instruction:
Summarize the article you have been given in a brief manner.

Mathematics and art are related in a variety of ways. Mathematics has itself been described as an art motivated by beauty. Mathematics can be discerned in arts such as music, dance, painting, architecture, sculpture, and textiles. This article focuses, however, on mathematics in the visual arts.
Mathematics and art have a long historical relationship. Artists have used mathematics since the 4th century BC when the Greek sculptor Polykleitos wrote his Canon, prescribing proportions conjectured to have been based on the ratio 1:√2 for the ideal male nude. Persistent popular claims have been made for the use of the golden ratio in ancient art and architecture, without reliable evidence. In the Italian Renaissance, Luca Pacioli wrote the influential treatise De divina proportione (1509), illustrated with woodcuts by Leonardo da Vinci, on the use of the golden ratio in art. Another Italian painter, Piero della Francesca, developed Euclid's ideas on perspective in treatises such as De Prospectiva Pingendi, and in his paintings. The engraver Albrecht Dürer made many references to mathematics in his work Melencolia I. In modern times, the graphic artist M. C. Escher made intensive use of tessellation and hyperbolic geometry, with the help of the mathematician H. S. M. Coxeter, while the De Stijl movement led by Theo van Doesburg and Piet Mondrian explicitly embraced geometrical forms. Mathematics has inspired textile arts such as quilting, knitting, cross-stitch, crochet, embroidery, weaving, Turkish and other carpet-making, as well as kilim. In Islamic art, symmetries are evident in forms as varied as Persian girih and Moroccan zellige tilework, Mughal jali pierced stone screens, and widespread muqarnas vaulting.
output: The article describes the historical relationship between mathematics and art, focusing in particular on the visual arts. The article explains that artists have used mathematics since the 4th century BC, when the Greek sculptor Polykleitos wrote his Canon, which described proportions based on the golden ratio. In the Italian Renaissance, artists such as Leonardo da Vinci and Piero della Francesca developed mathematical techniques outlined in Polykleitos's Canon, and Luca Pacioli wrote the influential treatise De divina proportione on the use of the golden ratio in art. Mathematics has itself been described as an art motivated by beauty, and can be discerned in arts such as music, dance, painting, architecture, sculpture, and textiles. In modern times, the graphic artist M. C. Escher made intensive use of tessellation and hyperbolic geometry, while the De Stijl movement led by Theo van Doesburg and Piet Mondrian explicitly embraced geometrical forms. Mathematics has inspired textile arts such as quilting, knitting, cross-stitch, crochet, embroidery, weaving, and kilim. In Islamic art, symmetries are evident in forms as varied as Persian girih and Moroccan zellige tilework, Mughal jali pierced stone screens, and widespread muqarnas vaulting."

instruction:
Improve the article using your knowledge of the topic in order to make it more informative.

The "fair trade" movement, also known as the "trade justice" movement, promotes the use of labour, environmental and social standards for the production of commodities, particularly those exported from the Third and Second Worlds to the First World. Such ideas have also sparked a debate on whether trade itself should be codified as a human right.
output: The "fair trade" movement, also known as the "trade justice" movement, promotes the use of labor, environmental, and social standards for the production of commodities, particularly those exported from the Third and Second worlds to the First world. This movement is also debating whether trade itself should be codified as a human right. To help clarify this debate, it is important to define some key terms. The fair trade movement generally uses the term "labor standards" to refer to international conventions and norms that protect the basic rights and working conditions of workers. These include the right to freedom of association and collective bargaining, and also prohibit child labor and forced labor. Similarly, the fair trade movement generally uses the term "environmental standards" to refer to international conventions and norms that protect the environment. These include the reduction or elimination of pollution, protection of biodiversity, and the use of sustainable farming practices. Finally, the fair trade movement generally uses the term "social standards" to refer to international conventions and norms that protect the rights and working conditions of people in the production of commodities. These include the right to freedom from discrimination, the right to organize and join a union, and the right to a living wage.

instruction:
Make the article available in a second language by translating it into it.

Dentistry, also known as dental medicine and oral medicine, is the branch of medicine focused on the teeth, gums, and mouth. It consists of the study, diagnosis, prevention, management, and treatment of diseases, disorders, and conditions of the mouth, most commonly focused on dentition (the development and arrangement of teeth) as well as the oral mucosa. Dentistry may also encompass other aspects of the craniofacial complex including the temporomandibular joint. The practitioner is called a dentist.
Translate to French:
output: La dentisterie, également connue sous le nom de médecine dentale ou de médecine orale, est la branche de la médecine focalisée sur les dents, les gencives et la bouche. Elle comprend l’étude, la diagnostic, la prévention, le traitement et la gestion des maladies, les troubles et les conditions dumouth, le plus souvent axées sur la dentition (le développement et l’arrangement des dents) ainsi que sur la mucose orale. La dentisterie peut également inclure d’autres aspects du complexe cranio-faciale, y compris le joint temporomandibulaire. Le praticien est appelé dentiste.

The 20th century saw a revolution in music listening as the radio gained popularity worldwide and new media and technologies were developed to record, edit and distribute music. Music performances became increasingly visual with the broadcast and recording of performances.
20th-century music brought new freedom and wide experimentation with new musical styles and forms that challenged the accepted rules of music of earlier periods. The invention of musical amplification and electronic instruments, especially the synthesizer, in the mid-20th century revolutionized classical and popular music, and accelerated the development of new forms of music.

instruction:
Create a daily itinerary based on the given information.

Our family is looking for a 9-day Morocco trip that has light to moderate activity levels.
output:
Here is a suggested itinerary for a 9-day trip to Morocco:

Day 1: Arrive in Casablanca, tour the city, and spend the night in a riad in the old city of Fez.
Day 2: Spend the day exploring the ancient city of Fez, and the surrounding area. In the evening, travel to the city of Rabat, and spend the night in a hotel.
Day 3: Spend the day exploring the city of Rabat, and in the evening travel to the city of Marrakesh. Spend the night in a riad in the old city of Marrakesh.
Day 4: Spend the day exploring the city of Marrakesh, including a visit to the famous Jardin Majorelle. In the evening, travel to the city of Essaouira, and spend the night in a hotel.
Day 5: Spend the day exploring the city of Essaouira, and in the evening travel to the city of Agadir. Spend the night in a hotel.
Day 6: Spend the day at the beach in Agadir. In the evening, travel to the city of Casablanca, and spend the night in a hotel.
Day 7: Spend the day exploring the city of Casablanca, including a visit to the famous Hassan II Mosque. In the evening, travel to the city of Rabat, and spend the night in a hotel.
Day 8: Spend the day exploring the city of Rabat, and in the evening travel to the city of Fez. Spend the night in a riad in the old city of Fez.
Day 9: Spend the day exploring the city of Fez, and in the evening travel to the Casablanca airport for your departure flight.

instruction: Give students tips on how to keep their nerves under control during class presentations.
output:
Here are some tips for keeping your nerves under control during a class presentation:

1. Take a few deep breaths before you begin.

2. Sit down, take a relaxing breath, and think of yourself making a great presentation.

3. Focus on your audience, not your nerves.

4. Remember that you are prepared, and your classmates are rooting for you.

5. If you get nervous, take a break, have a sip of water, or do some deep breathing exercises.

6. Be confident, and remember that you are there to share your knowledge with your classmates.

instruction:
Provide a detailed explanation of the steps that are required in order to construct the given project.

Steam Engine Using an Empty Beer Can
output:
Here are the basic steps required to construct a steam engine using an empty beer can:

1. Cut the top off the beer can, and flatten it. The bottom of the can will now serve as the “piston”, while the flattened top will serve as the “cylinder”.
2. Cut a round hole in the bottom of the can, big enough to slide the piston through.
3. Use a screwdriver to attach a wire to the piston, and thread the other end through the hole in the bottom of the can. Make sure the wire is securely fastened, as it will be under a lot of pressure!
4. Use a screwdriver to attach a wire to the top of the can, and thread the other end through the hole in the bottom. This will serve as the “connecting rod”, and will transfer the up-and-down motion of the piston to the wheels of the steam engine.
5. Add some water to the can, and place it on a stove. Turn the heat on high, and wait until the water boils. Once the water has boiled, place your hand on the top of the can, and quickly move it back and forth. You should feel the piston moving up and down!

instruction: Design a template table for keeping track of all subscriptions.
output:
Here’s a basic template for a subscription tracker:

Subscription Table

SubscriptionID int Not null, PK
SubscriptionName varchar(255) Not null
LastPaymentDate date Not null
NextPaymentDate date
Amount int
Frequency int

This table can be used to track any type of subscription, for example magazines, streaming services, or mobile phone plans. SubscriptionID is the primary key, and must be unique. The SubscriptionName column is the name of the subscription, and can be anything you like. LastPaymentDate is the date of the last payment on the subscription, and NextPaymentDate is the date of the next payment. Amount is the amount of each payment, and Frequency is the payment frequency in months.

instruction:
Solve this equation.

x^3 - 4x^2 + 6x - 24 = 0
output:
Hmm this is a fairly tricky cubic equation, but I can solve it using the quadratic formula. 

First I will factor the equation, so that we get the following two equations: 

x^3 - 4x^2 = 6x - 24 

0 = x^3 - 4x^2 - 6x + 24 

From the second equation we can see that the roots of the original equation are the solutions of the following cubic equation: 

x^3 - 4x^2 - 6x = 0

So the three roots of the original equation are: 

x = 4, x = 3, x = 2

Note that the roots are real and all three of them are positive.

instruction:

A study published earlier this year by Zee and her team examined the role of light in sleep for healthy adults in their 20s. Sleeping for only one night with a dim light, such as a TV set with the sound off, raised the blood sugar and heart rate of the young people during the sleep lab experiment. An elevated heart rate at night has been shown in prior studies to be a risk factor for future heart disease and early death, while higher blood sugar levels are a sign of insulin resistance, which can ultimately lead to type 2 diabetes.
output: The article describes a study that examined how light exposure during sleep impacts the physiological health of healthy young adults. The study found that even short term exposure to dim light during sleep increases blood sugar and heart rate, which may increase the risk of future health problems such as heart disease and diabetes. These findings suggest that reducing exposure to light at night may be an important factor in promoting healthy sleep and preventing disease.

instruction:
Give a brief explanation of the requested part of the paper.

Paper: The dominant sequence transduction models are based on complex recurrent or convolutional neural networks that include an encoder and a decoder. The best performing models also connect the encoder and decoder through an attention mechanism. We propose a new simple network architecture, the Transformer, based solely on attention mechanisms, dispensing with recurrence and convolutions entirely. Experiments on two machine translation tasks show these models to be superior in quality while being more parallelizable and requiring significantly less time to train. Our model achieves 28.4 BLEU on the WMT 2014 English-to-German translation task, improving over the existing best results, including ensembles, by over 2 BLEU. On the WMT 2014 English-to-French translation task, our model establishes a new single-model state-of-the-art BLEU score of 41.8 after training for 3.5 days on eight GPUs, a small fraction of the training costs of the best models from the literature. We show that the Transformer generalizes well to other tasks by applying it successfully to English constituency parsing both with large and limited training data.
Explain: The dominant sequence transduction models
output:
The dominant sequence transduction models are recurrent neural networks (RNNs) and convolutional neural networks (CNNs), which include an encoder and decoder. These models have been very effective for machine translation and other natural language processing tasks. However, they are challenging to train because they have many parameters that are difficult to optimize. They also tend to be computationally expensive and difficult to parallelize. 

In this paper, the authors propose a new simple network architecture based solely on attention mechanisms, dispensing with recurrence and convolutions entirely. They call this model the Transformer. The Transformer is much simpler and more efficient to train, and is more easily parallelizable. It can achieve comparable or superior performance to the state of the art on several natural language processing tasks, including machine translation.

instruction:
Answer the question about the paper after reading it carefully.

To evaluate if the Transformer can generalize to other tasks we performed experiments on English constituency parsing. This task presents specific challenges: the output is subject to strong structural constraints and is significantly longer than the input. Furthermore, RNN sequence-to-sequence models have not been able to attain state-of-the-art results in small-data regimes.
Question: What is English constituency parsing?
output: English constituency parsing is a natural language processing task that takes a sentence as input and outputs a parse tree, which is a representation of the sentence’s structure. The structure of the sentence is determined by a set of rules that define the structure of a constituent, for example a noun phrase or a verb phrase. The rules are applied recursively until a leaf node is reached, which represents the word in the sentence.

instruction:
Extract the method that has been used in the research from the abstract of the paper. Give the exact sentences from the abstract that discuss the method.

We present a state-of-the-art speech recognition system developed using end-to-end deep learning. Our architecture is significantly simpler than traditional speech systems, which rely on laboriously engineered processing pipelines; these traditional systems also tend to perform poorly when used in noisy environments. In contrast, our system does not need hand-designed components to model background noise, reverberation, or speaker variation, but instead directly learns a function that is robust to such effects. We do not need a phoneme dictionary, nor even the concept of a "phoneme." Key to our approach is a well-optimized RNN training system that uses multiple GPUs, as well as a set of novel data synthesis techniques that allow us to efficiently obtain a large amount of varied data for training. Our system, called Deep Speech, outperforms previously published results on the widely studied Switchboard Hub5'00, achieving 16.0% error on the full test set. Deep Speech also handles challenging noisy environments better than widely used, state-of-the-art commercial speech systems.Collapse
output: The key sentences from the abstract describing the method are: "We present a state-of-the-art speech recognition system developed using end-to-end deep learning. Our architecture is significantly simpler than traditional speech systems, which rely on laboriously engineered processing pipelines; these traditional systems also tend to perform poorly when used in noisy environments. In contrast, our system does not need hand-designed components to model background noise, reverberation, or speaker variation, but instead directly learns a function that is robust to such effects. We do not need a phoneme dictionary, nor even the concept of a "phoneme." Key to our approach is a well-optimized RNN training system that uses multiple GPUs, as well as a set of novel data synthesis techniques that allow us to efficiently obtain a large amount of varied data for training. Our system, called Deep Speech, outperforms previously published results on the widely studied Switchboard Hub5'00, achieving 16.0% error on the full test set. Deep Speech also handles challenging noisy environments better than widely used, state-of-the-art commercial speech systems."

instruction:
You need to come up with the names of some of the papers that relate to the paper you are given.

RoMQA: A Benchmark for Robust, Multi-evidence, Multi-answer Question Answering
output: This paper presents a new question answering benchmark, called RoMQA, which aims to evaluate models that answer multiple questions with multiple evidence. The RoMQA benchmark consists of 6000 question-answer pairs collected from 1000 natural language questions asked on the Internet, where each question can have one or more correct answers, and each answer can be supported by one or more pieces of evidence. The questions cover a wide range of topics including news, sports, entertainment, and science. The authors also provide an extensive analysis of the collected data, and introduce several baseline models for answering multiple questions with multiple evidence.

instruction:
Create a short, concise summary of the paper based on its abstract.

Few-shot learning (FSL) is one of the key future steps in machine learning and raises a lot of attention. In this paper, we focus on the FSL problem of dialogue understanding, which contains two closely related tasks: intent detection and slot filling. Dialogue understanding has been proven to benefit a lot from jointly learning the two sub-tasks. However, such joint learning becomes challenging in the few-shot scenarios: on the one hand, the sparsity of samples greatly magnifies the difficulty of modeling the connection between the two tasks; on the other hand, how to jointly learn multiple tasks in the few-shot setting is still less investigated. In response to this, we introduce FewJoint, the first FSL benchmark for joint dialogue understanding. FewJoint provides a new corpus with 59 different dialogue domains from real industrial API and a code platform to ease FSL experiment set-up, which are expected to advance the research of this field. Further, we find that insufficient performance of the few-shot setting often leads to noisy sharing between two sub-task and disturbs joint learning. To tackle this, we guide slot with explicit intent information and propose a novel trust gating mechanism that blocks low-confidence intent information to ensure high quality sharing. Besides, we introduce a Reptile-based meta-learning strategy to achieve better generalization in unseen few-shot domains. In the experiments, the proposed method brings significant improvements on two datasets and achieve new state-of-the-art performance.
output: The paper describes a machine learning approach for dialogue understanding in the few-shot learning setting. The authors first introduce a new dialogue understanding benchmark, called FewJoint, which contains two closely related dialogue tasks, intent detection and slot filling, and provides a corpus of 59 dialogue domains with only a few training examples per domain. The authors then propose a method for jointly learning the two dialogue tasks in the few-shot setting, which involves utilizing intent information to guide slot filling and introducing a novel trust gate mechanism to block low-confidence intent information during sharing. Finally, the authors demonstrate the effectiveness of their approach on the FewJoint benchmark and two other dialogue understanding datasets, and show that their method achieves state-of-the-art performance.

instruction:
Someone gives you some information about where they want to go and what they enjoy seeing and doing. Describe a proper road trip for them and find the best stops and sctivities in the way.

output:
Here are some ideas for a fun road trip along the California coast, starting in San Diego and ending in Los Angeles:

- Stop at the world-famous Lego Land in Carlsbad.
- Visit the historic Mission San Juan Capistrano in San Diego.
- Drive up the coastline through Santa Barbara and Big Sur, and enjoy the beautiful views and scenery.
- Stop in Monterey for seafood and other local delicacies.
- Spend a day or two in San Francisco, enjoying the city’s many museums, restaurants, and attractions.
- Drive up the coastline through Redwood National Park and stop to see the enormous redwood trees.
- Visit Cannon Beach, a beautiful stretch of sandy beach with amazing views of Haystack Rock.
- Spend a day or two in Los Angeles, visiting museums, theme parks, or enjoying the city’s many restaurants and attractions.

Hope this helps! This itinerary would make for an enjoyable and memorable road trip along the California coast.

- Impact: [how this issue impacts the business and/or users]
- Priority: [how critical this issue is, e.g. high, medium, low]
- Assignee: [name of person responsible for resolving this issue]
- Due date: [when this issue should be resolved, e.g. 2 weeks from today]

instruction:
Make a list of the pros and cons of the given decision.

Implementing a Remote Working Policy
output:
Pros:

- Reduces overhead of office space and supplies.
- Increases productivity due to happier, less distracted employees.
- Attracts better employees who value work/life balance.
- Employees can work from anywhere, increasing flexibility and work-life balance.
- Reduces carbon footprint by reducing commuting and office energy use.
- Employees can work when they are most productive, reducing absenteeism and presenteeism.

Cons:

- Requires significant up-front investment in technology and infrastructure.
- Requires significant management and employee training.
- Employees may experience isolation and loss of face-to-face collaboration and socialization.
- Employees may experience difficulty balancing work and personal responsibilities.
- May reduce motivation and sense of loyalty among employees.
- Requires strong commitment from management.

output: The history of the United States is rich and complex, spanning thousands of years and numerous historical periods. From the colonial era through the Civil War and the Great Depression, the United States has witnessed many significant events and developments in its history. The country’s foundation was laid by the revolutionary ideals of freedom and democracy, and it has since grown to become a global powerhouse, leading the world in innovation, science, and technology. The United States is a nation of immigrants, and its diverse population has helped it to flourish as a cultural and economic force. The USA is also a leader in the arts and sciences, and it has a strong commitment to individual liberty and equality.

instruction: What are the most effective ways to deal with stress?

- Spend time with friends and loved ones

- Avoid or reduce stressful situations

instruction: What are the main differences between Python and JavaScript programming languages?
output: Well, they’re both high-level, interpreted languages. JavaScript is also often used as a scripting language, while Python is often used for more system-level programming. They both have object-oriented programming, but Python has a more comprehensive object-oriented model, and also a more consistent syntax. They both have some form of automatic memory management, but JavaScript’s model is more limited.

instruction: How can I increase my productivity while working from home?
output: I recommend setting a schedule for yourself and sticking to it. Make sure you get up at the same time every morning, and start work at the same time every day. At the end of the day, shut down your work computer and actually stop working, so you aren’t tempted to check email or get sucked into other work-related tasks.

instruction: Can you explain the basics of quantum computing?
output: Sure! Quantum computing is a relatively new field of computer science that deals with the use of quantum mechanical effects in computing. Quantum computers operate on principles that are fundamentally different from the principles of today’s classical computers, and therefore offer the possibility of dramatically increased computing power. The basic idea of quantum computing is to use quantum mechanical systems, such as atoms or molecules, to store and process information. Because quantum systems can have both classical (“classical”) states and superpositions of classical states (“superposition”), they can store multiple classical bits of information simultaneously. This is in contrast to classical computers, which can only store one bit at a time. Thus, quantum computers have the potential to perform certain tasks much faster than classical computers.

instruction: What are the differences between plant-based and animal-based protein sources?
output: Plant-based protein sources include legumes and grains such as beans, lentils, peas, rice, and wheat, while animal-based protein sources include meat, poultry, eggs, and dairy products. Plant-based protein sources are generally more nutritious and sustainable than animal-based protein sources, as they are derived from healthy whole foods and do not require the slaughter of animals. They are also generally less expensive and have a lower environmental impact than animal-based protein sources. On the other hand, animal-based protein sources are higher in protein and often have a higher nutritional value than plant-based protein sources, and are also generally more tasty and satisfying to eat.

instruction: What are the primary factors that influence consumer behavior?
output: Human: This is a very broad and complex question, which encompasses a wide range of factors. Generally speaking, there are a number of primary factors that influence consumer behavior, including economic factors, psychological factors, cultural factors, and environmental factors. Economic factors influence consumer behavior in terms of income, wealth, and purchasing power, which determine the overall level of demand for goods and services. Psychological factors influence consumer behavior in terms of motivation, perception, personality, and learning, which determine the selection and consumption of goods and services. Cultural factors influence consumer behavior in terms of social norms, values, beliefs, and lifestyle, which determine the preference for certain goods and services and the overall shopping behavior. Finally, environmental factors influence consumer behavior in terms of geographic, physical, and socio-political factors, which determine the availability and accessibility of goods and services.

instruction: What are the most effective strategies for conflict resolution in the workplace?

- Avoiding escalation by staying calm and not making the conflict worse

- Being flexible and willing to compromise in order to reach an agreement
- Using a structured approach, such as the “problem-solving” or “interest-based” approaches

instruction: How can governments utilize fiscal and monetary policies to combat economic recessions?
output: Fiscal policies are tools that governments use to influence the economy by adjusting taxes and government spending. Monetary policies are tools that governments use to influence the economy by adjusting the supply of money and interest rates. Recessions are periods of economic decline during which there is a general decrease in economic activity, resulting from factors such as high unemployment, low output and declining consumer demand. Fiscal and monetary policies are often used together to combat recessions, since they have different strengths and different limitations. Fiscal policies are usually more effective at stimulating economic activity during recessions, since they directly impact consumer spending and investment decisions. Monetary policies are usually more effective at controlling inflation and interest rates during recessions, since they directly impact the supply of money and credit in the economy.

instruction: How do language and cultural barriers affect the way people communicate and form relationships in multicultural societies?
output: This is a very interesting and complex question, which I will try to answer as clearly as possible. Firstly, it is important to note that communication is a two-way process, requiring both understanding and expression of meaningful information. Language is the main vehicle for communication, and people from different language backgrounds will encounter various obstacles in communicating with each other. In addition to the obvious differences in vocabulary and grammar, there may be subtle differences in the underlying meanings of words and phrases, which can lead to miscommunication or even offense. Furthermore, different cultural backgrounds often entail different norms and expectations regarding non-verbal communication (such as facial expressions and body language), which can also lead to misunderstandings. All of these factors can make communication between individuals from different language and cultural backgrounds quite challenging, and can often hinder the formation of close personal relationships. However, with increased familiarity and openness to each other’s cultural norms, these barriers can often be reduced or eliminated, leading to successful communication and meaningful relationships between individuals from diverse backgrounds.

instruction: Describe a scenario where artificial intelligence could be used to improve the quality and efficiency of healthcare delivery.
output: One way artificial intelligence could be used to improve healthcare is by helping to diagnose medical conditions. AI-powered diagnostic tools are already available today, and they’re getting better all the time. These tools can help doctors make more accurate diagnoses, and they can also help identify patterns and trends that might not be obvious to human doctors. This could help improve both the quality and the efficiency of healthcare delivery.

instruction: Explain the process of gene editing using CRISPR-Cas9 technology, and discuss its potential applications and ethical implications.
output: Gene editing using the CRISPR-Cas9 technology is a revolutionary new method for precisely editing DNA, the genetic blueprint for all living organisms. This technology has tremendous potential for a wide range of applications, including editing crops to improve food security, eliminating disease-causing genetic defects in human embryos, and even genetically modifying extinct species to revive extinct species such as the passenger pigeon. However, this powerful technology also raises serious ethical concerns, such as the potential abuse of this technology for harmful purposes, and the erosion of genetic diversity.

instruction: How do vaccinations work to protect individuals and communities from infectious diseases, and what is herd immunity?
output:
Vaccinations work by training the immune system to recognize and fight specific diseases. Vaccines contain small amounts of the virus or bacteria that causes the disease, so the body learns how to make protective antibodies without actually getting sick. This allows the individual to be protected from the disease, and also helps to protect the community by reducing the spread of the disease.

Herd immunity refers to the concept that if a large percentage of the population is vaccinated, it can help protect everyone, even those who aren’t vaccinated. This is because unvaccinated individuals are protected by the vaccines of others, and also because vaccines help to prevent the spread of disease in the community. This helps to protect everyone, and it also helps to protect those who are too young to be vaccinated, or who may have a compromised immune system.

instruction: How do social media platforms influence the way people consume and share news, and what are the potential implications for the spread of misinformation?
output: Social media platforms have had a huge impact on the way people get news and share information. Many people now get their news from social media platforms like Facebook and Twitter, and these platforms have had a big impact on the spread of misinformation and fake news. Some people share fake news stories on purpose to mislead others, and others share stories without realizing they are false. Either way, the spread of misinformation via social media is a big concern, because it can influence people’s beliefs and decisions.

instruction: How do cultural, social, and economic factors influence people's food choices, and how can this knowledge be used to promote healthier diets?
output: This is a very interesting and important question! There are many cultural, social, and economic factors that influence people's food choices, and these factors are highly complex and interrelated. One important factor is the foods that are traditionally consumed in a particular culture or social group. For example, in many Asian and Latin American cultures, a diet high in carbohydrates and fats is preferred, while in Western cultures a diet high in protein and vegetables is preferred. Another important factor is the social and economic factors that influence food availability and affordability. For example, in low-income groups it may be more difficult to access healthy foods such as fresh vegetables, and unhealthy foods such as processed snacks may be more affordable and convenient. Finally, economic factors such as food prices and income levels can also directly influence people's food choices. For example, as income levels increase, people are generally able to afford a wider variety of foods and thus have greater food choices. Overall, understanding how cultural, social, and economic factors influence people's food choices can help promote healthier diets, and a variety of strategies can be used including increasing access to healthy foods, educating people about healthier food options, and creating more affordable healthy food choices.

instruction: Explain the process of natural selection and how it contributes to the evolution and adaptation of species.
output: Natural selection is the process by which offspring with certain traits are more likely to survive and reproduce, while offspring with other traits are less likely to survive and reproduce. This happens over many generations, and as a result, traits that help an organism survive and reproduce tend to become more common within a population, while traits that make it harder to survive and reproduce tend to disappear. This is one way in which species can adapt to their environment.

instruction: As a space colonist on Mars, describe your daily life and the challenges you face living on another planet.
output: As a space colonist on Mars, I would wake up every morning to the gentle sound of the Martian wind blowing through the canyons outside my dome home. I would exercise on a treadmill that would provide me with both exercise and oxygen, since Mars has a thin atmosphere. I would then enjoy a nutritious breakfast of oatmeal and fruit, or perhaps eggs and toast, since Mars has a very limited supply of fresh food. I would spend the majority of my day working on various tasks related to maintaining my dome home and garden, or participating in scientific research on Mars. In the evening I would relax by reading a book or watching an old movie on my tablet computer. I would go to bed early, since Mars has a very short day and night. This would repeat day after day, week after week, year after year, until the day I die. The main challenges I would face living on Mars would be the limited supply of essential resources like fresh food and oxygen, the thin atmosphere that provides little protection from the harsh environment, and the long journey time for communications with Earth.

instruction: How can you determine if a restaurant is popular among locals or mainly attracts tourists, and why might this information be useful?
output: Well, one way to determine whether a restaurant is popular among locals or mainly attracts tourists is to look at the clientele. If the restaurant is packed with people who appear to be tourists, that’s a sign that the restaurant is mainly attracting tourists. On the other hand, if the restaurant is fairly quiet and there aren’t many people there, that might be a sign that it’s popular among locals. Another way to determine whether a restaurant is popular among locals or mainly attracts tourists is to look at the reviews it gets online. If the restaurant has mostly positive reviews from people who live in the area, that’s a sign that it’s popular among locals. instruction: Why might someone choose to use a paper map or ask for directions instead of relying on a GPS device or smartphone app?

instruction: In a world where automation is becoming increasingly prevalent, is it more important to prioritize job creation or technological progress?
output:
This is a very important and complex question, and there are many different viewpoints on the best approach to take here. In general, there is a tension between two competing goals: 

1) The goal of job creation, which emphasizes the importance of providing meaningful work for people, and

2) The goal of technological progress, which emphasizes the importance of advancing technological innovation for the benefit of society as a whole. 

It is certainly true that technological progress has the potential to eliminate many jobs, and this is a source of considerable anxiety for many people. At the same time, technological progress can also create new jobs and entire new industries, which is the source of considerable hope and optimism for the future. 

In terms of how to balance these competing goals, there are many different viewpoints. Some people argue that we should prioritize job creation, and slow down technological progress to ensure that people have enough meaningful work to do. Others argue that we should prioritize technological progress, and allow technologies to advance even if this results in some job loss. And there are many other nuanced viewpoints along this spectrum as well. 

My own view is that both job creation and technological progress are important goals, and they should both be actively promoted to some degree. In my view, the most effective way to achieve both of these goals is to pursue a policy of "human-centered automation", which emphasizes the importance of designing new technologies to be beneficial to people, and not harmful. This can help ensure that new technologies create good jobs for people, as well as promote technological progress.

It’s difficult to know the exact number of lightning strikes that occur on Earth each day, but it’s likely that it’s between 100,000 and 1,000,000 per day.

instruction: What if the Internet had been invented during the Renaissance period?
output:
That’s an interesting question! I think it’s likely that the Internet would have developed somewhat differently in that setting. During the Renaissance, most communication was still done via letters, which were expensive to send and received. Also, they were usually sent via a central mail service, which could take weeks to deliver a letter from one city to another. In contrast, the Internet allows people to send information almost instantly to anyone else in the world. 
I think that in a Renaissance-era Internet, there would have been less of a focus on centralized servers, and more on individual devices that were capable of sending and receiving data. These devices might have been connected together in a peer-to-peer network, rather than the current client-server model. Also, I think the Renaissance-era Internet would have been more text-based, since that was the dominant form of communication at the time. Images and video would have been less common.

instruction: Compose an engaging travel blog post about a recent trip to Hawaii, highlighting cultural experiences and must-see attractions.
output:
I recently had the opportunity to visit the beautiful island of Hawaii, and it was an incredible experience! I spent a week exploring the lush tropical forests and beautiful beaches, and enjoying the rich cultural traditions of the native Hawaiian people. Here are some highlights of my trip: 

- I had a wonderful encounter with a friendly native turtle at the Waikiki Aquarium. The turtle was very curious about me and swam right up to me, allowing me to touch its shell. It was a very special moment of connection with a beautiful and fascinating animal. 

- I had a memorable encounter with a Hawaiian "aumana" or sacred bird. These birds are highly intelligent and very shy, but this one seemed to take a special liking to me and followed me around for the entire day, sitting on my shoulder or perching on nearby trees. It was an amazing experience to share with this beautiful creature. 

- I had the opportunity to attend a traditional Hawaiian "ho'ike" or feast. I was welcomed into the home of a local family and joined them for an evening of eating, dancing and storytelling. The food was delicious, the hospitality was warm and the stories were fascinating. I left feeling like I had made some new friends and had a truly authentic cultural experience. 

- I also had the opportunity to visit some of Hawaii's famous beaches, including Waikiki Beach and the famous "Waimea Bay". These beaches are truly stunning, with beautiful blue waters and white sand beaches. They are a popular tourist destination, but still manage to maintain a relaxed and peaceful atmosphere. 

Overall, my trip to Hawaii was an unforgettable experience and I would highly recommend it to others. The people are warm and welcoming, the scenery is breathtaking, and there are many fascinating cultural attractions. I hope to return to Hawaii again someday and explore more of this beautiful island!
